definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
component in Chinese characters/archaic variant of 毫[hao2]/archaic variant of 乙[yi3]
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]

sentences.english: His old legs and shoulders pivoted with the swinging of the pulling.
sentences.chinese: 他一把把地拉着，两条老迈的腿儿和肩膀跟着转动。

sentences.english: The land is covered in shrubs.
The gold peal son station rises and unexpectedly wants Pan teacher in pique.
sentences.chinese: 金铃儿愤然站起，竟是要叛师。

sentences.english: Sophie:Now wash them, then dice the potatoes and bell peppers. Then slice the meat.
sentences.chinese: 现在把他们都洗干净，青椒和土豆切成丁儿，肉切片。

sentences.english: A small piece of pottery under a rock might be a clue to the past.
sentences.chinese: 岩石下面的一小片儿瓷器可能就是研究过去的线索。

sentences.english: Frank, how about some bacon with your French toast ?
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克，弄点儿咸肉就着煎面包片儿吃好不好？

sentences.english: What I'm wondering is, is Giselle doing the right thing?
sentences.chinese: 我怀疑的是吉赛儿做的决定是对的吗？

sentences.english: Around 11:30 on the second day, the food trolley came around again.
sentences.chinese: 大概第二天的11点半钟，食品小车儿又来啦。

sentences.english: Well, you know what a canadian chipmunk looks like?
sentences.chinese: 那你知道一只加拿大花栗鼠长什么样儿的吗？

sentences.english: If it doesn t crunch or crinkle, he wont eat it.
sentences.chinese: 不能发出嘎吱作响或者沙沙声儿的食物他是不会吃的。

sentences.english: One day he saw a farmer working in the field. The farmer was working very hard under the hot sun.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他看到一位农民叔叔在炎热的天气下地干活儿。

sentences.english: Today, a move of the child, the simple mind, most of the food to eat.
sentences.chinese: 今天学了一招儿，简单记一下，最该吃的食物。

sentences.english: With this and my black coat, I’ll be dressed for the season.
sentences.chinese: 再加上那件黑大褂儿，我这一季的衣服就全了。

sentences.english: I had to buy a new pair of laces for my tennis shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我得为我的网球鞋买双新鞋带儿。

sentences.english: But the noteworthy history still haunts this meeting.
sentences.chinese: 但那段儿著名的历史仍然“阴魂不散”。

sentences.english: One should bring a flashlight when walking in mountains at night.
sentences.chinese: 夜里走山路，应该带上电棒儿。

definition: one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
I or me/we (including both the speaker and the person spoken to)
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
dialectal equivalent of 什麼|什么[shen2 me5]/also pr. [sha4]
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/proximity/thread (of ideas, plots etc)/see also 邊|边[bian1]
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
dialectal equivalent of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
